remarks: The sequence of partial finite product of a converging infinite product converge to the infinite product of the series.  Note that ` j ` must not occur in ` A ` .  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 18-Dec-2017.)
statement:
iprodclim3.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
iprodclim3.2 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
iprodclim3.3 $e |- ( ph -> E. n e. Z E. y ( y =/= 0 /\ seq n ( x. , ( k e. Z |-> A ) ) ~~> y ) ) $.
iprodclim3.4 $e |- ( ph -> F e. dom ~~> ) $.
iprodclim3.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> A e. CC ) $.
iprodclim3.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ j e. Z ) -> ( F ` j ) = prod_ k e. ( M ... j ) A ) $.
iprodclim3 $p |- ( ph -> F ~~> prod_ k e. Z A ) $.
$d A j $.
$d A n y $.
$d F j $.
$d M j k $.
$d M k y $.
$d Z j k $.
$d Z k n y $.
$d j k ph $.
$d n ph y $.
